body:
Thanks for the details. Did you set the MLflow tracking URI in the program where you called mlflow.run too? The mlflow.run command creates the run, then spawns a process (train.py in this case) that uses that run ID, so it needs to be using the same tracking server. This error message makes it seem that the run does not exist on the tracking server.

Basically, in your Python code before mlflow.run(), add mlflow.set_tracking_uri(your URI).

Hi Mateiz,
Thanks a lot. That resolved the issue.
Another question, I want to run this code on the Spark Cluster, so can I use the "backend" for that purpose.? If so how? I do not have DataBricks, just a Spark Cluster

Also, the GIT URL that we use, can it be folder specific.
For example in the GIT repository if I make multiple folder for different runs with each folder having an MLProject file and python file with the code.
While calling the mlflow.projects.run APT in the GIT URI I add the name of the folder with the URI?

Those backend parameters are for running the job in a completely different compute environment, but you don't need to use them for a locally accessible Spark cluster. Just make sure that the machine you are running your project on can access the Spark cluster -- or submit the driver program itself as a job on that cluster if you're using something like YARN. The connection to Spark happens gets set up in your project code, not in MLflow.

For multiple projects in the same Git repo, I'd recommend creating an MLproject file that lists different entry points. See examples/multistep_workflow/MLproject for an example.

Thanks Mateiz.
It was very helpful.
I am facing another weird issue. I am unsure if it is related to mlflow or my Spark cluster
While using the projects run API:
I use the log_model API in my python code to log my model. However I get an error -java.lang.IllegalStateException(RPC channel is closed.)

It is strange since if I just run my code directly on the spark cluster without using the mlflow projects API, I do not get this error. Also the error is only while logging the model, I am able to log my parameters, metrix and other other artifacts.

Please let me know anything related to this
It's really hard to tell without a full stack trace for your exception. You should probably report a different issue for that.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.

Hi! I have the same issue but I believe that is because I'm setting the tracking server URI inside the python code instead of the environment variable. 

I'm setup my MLproject to use docker,  and when I run the project using `mlflow run` command that excecute the docker run command passing MLFLOW_TRACKING_SERVER env variable using as value my local environment value. And then creates the run_id. But the run_id is generated using the MLFLOW_TRACKING_SERVER at the moment of the execution of the docker run command, not using the MLFLOW_TRACKING_SERVER that I setup inside my code. 

There is any way to pass the MLFLOW_TRACKING_SERVER to the docker run comment with setting it as a local environment value?
Thank you for interacting with this issue! Removing the stale label!
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.

> Hi! I have the same issue but I believe that is because I'm setting the tracking server URI inside the python code instead of the environment variable.
> 
> I'm setup my MLproject to use docker, and when I run the project using `mlflow run` command that excecute the docker run command passing MLFLOW_TRACKING_SERVER env variable using as value my local environment value. And then creates the run_id. But the run_id is generated using the MLFLOW_TRACKING_SERVER at the moment of the execution of the docker run command, not using the MLFLOW_TRACKING_SERVER that I setup inside my code.
> 
> There is any way to pass the MLFLOW_TRACKING_SERVER to the docker run comment with setting it as a local environment value?

Hi @carlos-rodrigo, if you are still facing this issue, it would be better to create a new issue and spell out a bit more detail on how to reproduce the issue.

> Hi is there a way to specify how the spark job is run after being saved as a model, when i try to serve the model, it is choosing the wrong conda environment for each node. How do i specify the PYSPARK_PYTHON and DRIVER_PYSPARK_PYTHON during serving the saved model, or at saving the model itself?
> 


Hi @y-tee, if you are still facing this issue, would you please create a new issue with a bit more detail on the Spark environment you are running in and how the model was created?

Hi, i have registered a model and i'm able to log parameter/metrics details when the code is executed individually. But when i run the same code through pipeline, it doesn't log parameters and gives error "RestException: User does not have any permission level assigned to the registered model. "

Can somebody please help me on where I'm going wrong?
